Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the Arcibasilica di Nostra Signora

Base:Description.day: The grand entrance to the Arcibasilica di Nostra Signora is spacious and welcoming. Brilliant light pours in from every corner of the room, illuminating the area as if the divine presence of God was here this precise moment. This area is called the narthex, and it is separated from the rest of the cathedral by a low wall to the north. Bisecting that wall is an arch flanked on either side by a silver candelabra. Those who do not follow the religion of Christ are restricted to this part of the cathedral, as are others during certain ceremonies. Prominently displayed high on the southern wall is a massive rose window. At the center of the room is a font where you may wash your sins before entering the cathedral proper. In each corner of the room are four highly polished statues of religious figures. The figures stand tall and proud as they take up a stance similar to a faithful guardian.
Base:Description.night: The grand entrance to the Arcibasilica di Nostra Signora is spacious and welcoming. Dimmed lights pour in from the evening, basking the area is a soft, ethereal glow. This area is called the narthex, and it is separated from the rest of the cathedral by a low wall to the north. Bisecting that wall is an arch flanked on either side by a silver candelabra. Those who do not follow the religion of Christ are restricted to this part of the cathedral, as are others during certain ceremonies. Prominently displayed high on the southern wall is a massive rose window. At the center of the room is a font where you may wash your sins before entering the cathedral proper. In each corner of the room are four highly polished statues of religious figures. The figures stand tall and proud as they take up a stance similar to a faithful guardian.

Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: The narthex is the entrance to the Arcibasilica di Nostra Signora. A low wall seperates this area from the nave to the north. In the center of the room is a large font.
a white marble arch leading north

The passage to the north is through an arch that stands directly in the middle of the low wall separating the narthex from the nave. It is clearly symbolic in nature, for the wall is low enough for a person to climb without difficulty. The arch is made of a smooth white marble, streaked with ribbons of silver. It is wide enough for two people to comfortably walk abreast and twice as tall as a man. The sides of the arch are carved with climbing vines, and at the apex is a carving of a cross with rays radiating from all sides. The arch is flanked by a pair of silver candelabras. $(parent-desc)
To the north lies a white marble arch standing directly in the middle of the low wall separating the narthex from the nave. $(parent-desc)
an ornate pair of doors leading south

These massive doors leading south look heavy and solid. They are made of solid oak banded with polished gold. In the center of each door is a blazing cross symbol done in gold leaf. Goldwork filigree traces each door delicately, reflecting the light of the room and granting an unearthly glow to the wood. $(parent-desc)
These massive oak doors leading south are each emblazoned with a golden cross symbol. $(parent-desc)
the ceiling

The ceiling stretches far, far overhead. It is supported by numerous striped arches that meet each other at right angles and even stack on top of one another. The ceiling itself is given a pristine whitewash and is lit well enough from below that none of it lies in shadow. Between the arches are painted intricate swirling shapes and circles interlocked in a complex design.
The ceiling far overhead arches upward out of the narthex and into the cathedral proper, becoming difficult to discern as it fades into the distant brightness.
the floor
Below your feet are white tiles of palest marble, polished to a fine sheen. Looking down you can see your own reflection:
Below your feet are white tiles of palest marble, polished to a fine sheen.
the rose window's frame

The frame of the rose window is intricate. The frame itself is made of gold, and is shaped of concentric circles and looping curves. The center of the frame is a circle, with twelve spokes radiating outward. Between the spokes are curves and crossing lines forming a web-like design. More wavy curves lie along the outer edge forming pointed arches.
The intricate frame of a rose window joins bars of lead together in twisting patterns throughout the design.
the rose window's stained glass

Situated in the central circle of the stained glass of the rose window is an image of the Virgin Mary. Radiating around the center are symbols of various constellations. On the outer edge of the window are the names of the months written in Latin. The stained glass itself is done in bright colors with red and blue most prominent.
The stained glass of the rose window is done mostly in bright red and blue colors. It is covered in various religious and astronomical symbols.
a statue of Matthew Levi

Here stands a tall, marble statue with the likeness of a thin but sturdy man. His hair is cut short, and his face is polished. He has thick, neat eyebrows, small eyes, and a prominent nose. His supple lips are gently curved into a half-smile as he gazes thoughtfully at the font. He dons an ankle-length tunic and within his hands, he clutches a hefty ledger. A small, golden plate sits below the statue, engraved with the name -Matthew Levi, The Money-Getter-.

Here stands a tall, marble statue with the likeness of a thin but sturdy man. His hair is cut short, and his face is polished. He has thick, neat eyebrows, small eyes, and a prominent nose. His supple lips are gently curved into a half-smile as he gazes thoughtfully at the font. He dons an ankle-length tunic and within his hands, he clutches a hefty ledger. A small, golden plate sits below the statue, engraved with the name -Matthew Levi, The Money-Getter-.
the rose window

The window is massive, and sprawls across the upper part of the middle of the southern wall. The frame of the circular window has a smaller circle in the center, with twelve spokes radiating from the center circle to the edge of the frame, and curves connect the spokes in a lattice almost like a spiderweb, or perhaps a flower, or a sun. The image of the Virgin Mary is in the center of the glass, with other images between the spokes surrounding her. The warm light of the sun makes the image of Mary seem to glow with the light of God.The window reflects the ambient candlelight, causing the stained glass to glitter like jewelry.
A massive circular window located above the entrance doors, made of stained glass and intricate in design. An image of the Virgin Mary can be seen in the center.
the eastern wall

The eastern wall extends nearly beyond sight to the distant ceiling above. It is made of plaster covered with a brilliant whitewash. Panels spaced along the wall hold intricate frescoes showing penitents of all shapes and sizes engaged in various forms of worship. The brilliant wall reflects the light of the room, suffusing the area in a warm glow.
The eastern wall is faced with a brilliantly whitewashed plaster. Panels spaced along the wall hold frescoes describing penitents in various forms of worship.
the southern wall

The southern wall extends nearly beyond sight to the distant ceiling above. It is made of plaster covered with a brilliant whitewash. Panels spaced along the wall hold intricate frescoes showing penitents of all shapes and sizes engaged in various forms of worship. The brilliant wall reflects the light of the room, suffusing the area in a warm glow. In the middle of the wall is a set of ornate double doors, and high above the doors is a massive rose window.

The southern wall is faced with a brilliantly whitewashed plaster. Panels spaced along the wall hold frescoes describing penitents in various forms of worship. In the middle of the wall is a set of ornate double doors.
the western wall

The western wall extends nearly beyond sight to the distant ceiling above. It is made of plaster covered with a brilliant whitewash. Panels spaced along the wall hold intricate frescoes showing penitents of all shapes and sizes engaged in various forms of worship. The brilliant wall reflects the light of the room, suffusing the area in a warm glow.
The western wall is faced with a brilliantly whitewashed plaster. Panels spaced along the wall hold frescoes describing penitents in various forms of worship.
